00036  * libcfs/include/libcfs/util/parser.h
00037  *
00038  * A command line parser.
00039  *
00040  */
00041 
00042 #ifndef _PARSER_H_
00043 #define _PARSER_H_
00044 
00045 #define HISTORY 100             /* Don't let history grow unbounded    */
00046 #define MAXARGS 512
00047 
00048 #define CMD_COMPLETE    0
00049 #define CMD_INCOMPLETE  1
00050 #define CMD_NONE        2
00051 #define CMD_AMBIG       3
00052 #define CMD_HELP        4
00053 
00054 typedef struct parser_cmd {
00055         char    *pc_name;
00056         int     (* pc_func)(int, char **);
00057         struct parser_cmd * pc_sub_cmd;
00058         char *pc_help;
00059 } command_t;
00060 
00061 typedef struct argcmd {
00062         char    *ac_name;
00063         int      (*ac_func)(int, char **);
00064         char     *ac_help;
00065 } argcmd_t;
00066 
00067 typedef struct network {
00068         char    *type;
00069         char    *server;
00070         int     port;
00071 } network_t;
00072 
00073 int Parser_quit(int argc, char **argv);
00074 int Parser_version(int argc, char **argv);
00075 void Parser_init(char *, command_t *);  /* Set prompt and load command list */
00076 int Parser_commands(void);                      /* Start the command parser */
00077 void Parser_qhelp(int, char **);        /* Quick help routine */
00078 int Parser_help(int, char **);          /* Detailed help routine */
00079 void Parser_ignore_errors(int ignore);  /* Set the ignore errors flag */
00080 void Parser_printhelp(char *);          /* Detailed help routine */
00081 void Parser_exit(int, char **);         /* Shuts down command parser */
00082 int Parser_execarg(int argc, char **argv, command_t cmds[]);
00083 int execute_line(char * line);
00084 
00085 /* Converts a string to an integer */
00086 int Parser_int(char *, int *);
00087 
00088 /* Prompts for a string, with default values and a maximum length */
00089 char *Parser_getstr(const char *prompt, const char *deft, char *res, 
00090                     size_t len);
00091 
00092 /* Prompts for an integer, with minimum, maximum and default values and base */
00093 int Parser_getint(const char *prompt, long min, long max, long deft,
00094                   int base);
00095 
00096 /* Prompts for a yes/no, with default */
00097 int Parser_getbool(const char *prompt, int deft);
00098 
00099 /* Extracts an integer from a string, or prompts if it cannot get one */
00100 long Parser_intarg(const char *inp, const char *prompt, int deft,
00101                    int min, int max, int base);
00102 
00103 /* Extracts a word from the input, or propmts if it cannot get one */
00104 char *Parser_strarg(char *inp, const char *prompt, const char *deft,
00105                     char *answer, int len);
00106 
00107 /* Extracts an integer from a string  with a base */
00108 int Parser_arg2int(const char *inp, long *result, int base);
00109 
00110 /* Convert human readable size string to and int; "1k" -> 1000 */
00111 int Parser_size(int *sizep, char *str);
00112 
00113 /* Convert a string boolean to an int; "enable" -> 1 */
00114 int Parser_bool(int *b, char *str);
00115 
00116 #endif
